bibl.title: Letter from J.C. Geiger to Henry Rose Carter, February 26, 1919

div1.p: Geiger writes that he was awarded a Doctor of Public Health degree from Tulane University.

div1.head: Letter from J.C. Geiger to Henry Rose Carter, February 26, 1919
div1.opener:
Relative to degree of
Doctor of Public Health
Conferred upon Dr. Geiger.
Ass't Epidemiologist J.C. Geiger.
Copy.
Little Rock, Ark.
City Hall Building,
February 26, 1919.
The Surgeon General,
U. S. Public Health Service,
Washington, D.C.
Sir:
div1.p:
I have the honor to state that notification
has been received from the president of Tulane University
that they have conferred upon me the active degree of
Doctor of Public Health. This honor I am afraid is not
deserved but it is most welcome in every way.
div1.closer:
Respectfully, J.C. Geiger
Ass't Epidemiologist. Copy to Dr. H. R. Carter.
Kindest regards
